data.title: Guide to word vectors with gensim and keras
data.description: Word vectors Today, I tell you what word vectors are, how you create them in python and finally how you can use them with neural networks in keras. For a long time, NLP methods use a vectorspace model to represent words.

data.title: Linear Algebra for Deep Learning
data.description: Linear algebra is a field of applied mathematics that is a prerequisite to reading and understanding the formal description of deep learning methods, such as in papers and textbooks. Generally, an understanding of linear algebra (or parts thereof) is presented as a prerequisite for machine learning. Although important, this area of mathematics is seldom covered […]

data.title: A Gentle Introduction to Sparse Matrices for Machine Learning
data.description: Matrices that contain mostly zero values are called sparse, distinct from matrices where most of the values are non-zero, called dense. Large sparse matrices are common in general and especially in applied machine learning, such as in data that contains counts, data encodings that map categories to counts, and even in whole subfields of machine […]

data.title: A Gentle Introduction to Broadcasting with NumPy Arrays
data.description: Arrays with different sizes cannot be added, subtracted, or generally be used in arithmetic. A way to overcome this is to duplicate the smaller array so that it is the dimensionality and size as the larger array. This is called array broadcasting and is available in NumPy when performing array arithmetic, which can greatly reduce […]

data.title: Reptile: A Scalable Meta-Learning Algorithm
data.description:

repeatedly sampling a task, performing stochastic gradient descent on it, and
updating the initial parameters towards the final parameters learned on that
task. Reptile is the application of the Shortest
